title: Clinical Reasoning & Organisation
checklist: Elicits information with logical, hypothesis-driven flow (no random jumps)
Begins each topic area with broad, open-ended enquiry before focusing down
Maintains canonical history order (HPI → ROS → PMH → Meds → Allergies → Social)
Explicitly screens for ‘red-flag’ symptoms or time-critical dangers early
Pursues abnormal or alarming answers with appropriate follow-up questions
Generates a sensible, articulated differential diagnosis during or at close
Verbally prioritises the most probable / most dangerous diagnoses with brief justification
